questions.question_text:
A project is at the closing stage. The project manager asks the team to perform closing functions at the next meeting.

Which two procedures will the project team perform? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Deliverable acceptance
D. Project audit

During the closing stage of a project, the team focuses on ensuring all deliverables are accepted by stakeholders (deliverable acceptance) and conducting audits or reviews to assess the project’s performance and compliance with processes (project audit).

Other options like stakeholder mapping, issue log updates, and risk register tracking are typically performed in earlier stages of the project.
this one of the questions in today's exam [ 03/12/2024

questions.question_text: In adaptive projects, who should approve the prioritization of the backlog?

discussion.content: this one of the questions in today's exam [ 03/12/2024]

choices.D: Add the work to the backlog.
choices.C: Ask for the priority level of the new request.
choices.A: Decompose the work and add it to the backlog.
choices.B: Put the request in a holding area.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Put the request in a holding area.

questions.question_text: What should be completed when the work-in-progress (WIP) limit is reached and new work has been requested?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C. List of resources
D. Description of work
E. Acceptance criteria

Selected Answer: CDE
The three components of a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) dictionary are:
Description of work: This includes detailed descriptions of the work and technical documentation for each WBS element. It provides clarity on what needs to be done for each component of the project. 
List of resources: It details the resource requirements for the project, which can include labor, materials, equipment, or any other resources necessary to complete the work. 
Acceptance criteria: This outlines the conditions that must be met for the project deliverables to be accepted. It ensures that the work meets the required standards and specifications.

Selected Answer: BDE
I think it should be B, D, E. List of resources (C) is managed separately from the WBS dictionary, while Description of risks (B) helps in identifying potential threats to the project's success and planning appropriate risk responses.

questions.question_text: What are the three components of a work breakdown structure (WBS) dictionary? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Análisis de viabilidad

El análisis de viabilidad es fundamental para evaluar si las soluciones propuestas son factibles en términos de recursos, costos, tiempo y capacidades. Esto ayuda a identificar cualquier discrepancia entre los resultados esperados y los recursos o limitaciones disponibles, lo cual es crucial antes de tomar una decisión de seguir adelante o no.

Selected Answer: C
C. Opportunity analysis
Opportunity analysis is more suitable for identifying problem areas after discrepancies are noted.

Selected Answer: D
D. Elicitation.
Elicitation is gathering information from stakeholders to understand their perspectives, needs, and requirements.

questions.question_text:
A business analyst is evaluating solutions against the expected results and logging defects along the way. The next task is to analyze the discrepancies prior to facilitating a go/no-go decision.

Which technique should be used as a starting point to uncover problem areas?
